title: P06-3007

sentences.text: We investigate independent and relevant event-based extractive mutli-document summarization approaches .
In this paper , events are defined as event terms and associated event elements .
With independent approach , we identify important contents by frequency of events .
With relevant approach , we identify important contents by PageRank algorithm on the event map constructed from documents .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents a study on event-based extractive multi-document summarization, defining events as event terms and associated elements, and exploring both independent and relevant approaches to identify important content.

Entity-relevant_approach.label: relevant approach
Entity-relevant_approach.description: The 'relevant approach' refers to a method in event-based extractive multi-document summarization that utilizes the PageRank algorithm to identify important content based on an event map constructed from the documents.

Entity-approach.label: approaches
Entity-approach.description: The term 'approaches' refers to the independent and relevant methodologies used for event-based extractive multi-document summarization, which involve identifying important content through frequency analysis and PageRank algorithms.

Entity-independent_approach.label: independent approach
Entity-independent_approach.description: The 'independent approach' refers to a method in event-based extractive multi-document summarization that identifies important content based on the frequency of event terms.

Entity-event_map.label: event map
Entity-event_map.description: The 'event map' refers to a data structure that organizes and represents events extracted from multiple documents, which is utilized in a PageRank algorithm to identify important content in the context of event-based extractive summarization.

Entity-event.label: events
Entity-event.description: In this paper, 'events' refers to defined event terms and their associated elements that are utilized in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization.

Entity-important_content.label: important contents
Entity-important_content.description: The term 'important contents' refers to the significant data or information extracted from documents based on the frequency of identified event terms in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization.

Entity-associated_event_element.label: associated event elements
Entity-associated_event_element.description: Associated event elements refer to the components or attributes that are linked to specific events, which are utilized in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization to identify and analyze important content.

Entity-event_element.label: event elements
Entity-event_element.description: Event elements refer to the components or aspects associated with events that are utilized in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization.

Entity-frequency_of_event.label: frequency of events
Entity-frequency_of_event.description: The 'frequency of events' refers to a metric used in the independent approach of event-based extractive multi-document summarization to identify important content by quantifying how often specific events occur within the analyzed documents.

Entity-document.label: documents
Entity-document.description: The term 'documents' refers to the collection of texts or written materials used as the basis for constructing an event map in the context of event-based extractive multi-document summarization.

Entity-encouraging.label: encouraging
Entity-encouraging.description: The term 'encouraging' refers to the positive outcomes observed in the experimental results of the event-based extractive multi-document summarization approaches discussed in the paper.

Entity-pagerank_algorithm.label: PageRank algorithm
Entity-pagerank_algorithm.description: The PageRank algorithm is a mathematical method used to rank web pages or nodes in a graph based on their importance, primarily by analyzing the structure of links between them.

Entity-experimental_result.label: Experimental results
Entity-experimental_result.description: Experimental results refer to the outcomes or findings obtained from conducting scientific experiments or research studies.

summary: We investigate independent and relevant event-based extractive mutli-document summarization approaches . In this paper , events are defined as event terms and associated event elements . With independent approach , we identify important contents by frequency of events . With relevant approach , we identify important contents by PageRank algorithm on the event map constructed from documents . Experimental results are encouraging .

Predicate-are_defined_as.label: are defined as
Predicate-are_defined_as.description: The predicate 'are defined as' establishes a relationship of equivalence or identity between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject can be understood or characterized by the properties or nature of the object. It serves to clarify or specify the meaning of the subject by linking it to a particular concept or category represented by the object.

Predicate-associated_with.label: associated with
Predicate-associated_with.description: The predicate 'associated with' indicates a relationship of connection or relevance between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject has a link, correlation, or relationship to the object in a meaningful way. This connection can imply that the subject influences, is influenced by, or shares characteristics with the object.

Predicate-identify.label: identify
Predicate-identify.description: The predicate 'identify' denotes the action of recognizing, determining, or establishing the existence or nature of the object in relation to the subject. It implies a process where the subject discerns or points out specific characteristics, features, or elements of the object, thereby clarifying or defining its significance or role within a given context.

Predicate-by.label: by
Predicate-by.description: The predicate 'by' indicates a means, method, or agent through which the subject is related to the object. It often signifies the manner in which an action is performed or the way in which a particular outcome is achieved, establishing a connection that highlights the role of the object in relation to the subject.

Predicate-identifies.label: identifies
Predicate-identifies.description: The predicate 'identifies' denotes the action of recognizing, determining, or establishing the existence or significance of the object by the subject. It implies a relationship where the subject actively discerns or points out specific characteristics, elements, or entities represented by the object, thereby establishing a connection between them.

Predicate-are_identified_by.label: are identified by
Predicate-are_identified_by.description: The predicate 'are identified by' establishes a relationship where the subject is recognized or characterized through the lens of the object. It implies that the object serves as a criterion, measure, or descriptor that helps to define or clarify the nature, significance, or attributes of the subject.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates that the subject employs or utilizes the object in some capacity. It signifies a functional relationship where the subject actively engages with the object to achieve a purpose, perform a task, or derive benefit from it. This connection implies that the object serves as a tool, resource, or method that the subject relies on in its operations or activities.

Predicate-is_applied_on.label: is applied on
Predicate-is_applied_on.description: The predicate 'is applied on' indicates that the subject, which is typically a method, technique, or algorithm, is utilized or executed in relation to the object, which represents a specific dataset, system, or context. This relationship signifies that the subject is being used to analyze, process, or derive insights from the object.

Predicate-constructed_from.label: constructed from
Predicate-constructed_from.description: The predicate 'constructed from' indicates a relationship where the subject is created or formed using the materials, components, or elements represented by the object. It implies that the object serves as a foundational or essential basis for the subject, highlighting the process of assembly or synthesis that leads to the existence of the subject.

Predicate-are.label: are
Predicate-are.description: The predicate 'are' serves as a linking verb that connects the subject to a complement, indicating a state of being or existence. It establishes an identity or condition between the subject and the object, often describing characteristics, qualities, or classifications of the subject.

Predicate-investigates.label: investigates
Predicate-investigates.description: The predicate 'investigates' denotes an action where the subject conducts a systematic examination or inquiry into the object, which represents a concept, method, or phenomenon. This action implies a thorough analysis aimed at uncovering insights, understanding relationships, or evaluating the effectiveness of the object in question.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or category that falls under the wider classification represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a larger set of concepts or categories, of which the subject is a part, thereby illustrating a generalization from the specific to the more inclusive.
